name: SEER Primary Tumor
title: SEER Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:**  Assign 000 for multifocal noninvasive Ta and Tis tumors.

**Note 2:**  If primary tumor is coded to in situ (code 000), then Behavior Code ICD-O-3 must be 2. 

**Note 3:**  The presence of muscle around the urethra varies between males and females and, in males, varies among the segments of the urethra. The outer muscular coat (muscularis) is absent in most of the male urethra except for the membranous portion. In females, the muscle coat is continuous from the bladder wall. In addition, in both males and females, there is sphincteric muscle, which may be smooth or skeletal muscle. Invasion of periurethral muscle, sphincter muscle or muscle at the neck are all assigned 200 for regional.
rows:
In situ: Noninvasive; intraepithelial

Carcinoma in situ, NOS
Noninvasive papillary, polypoid, or verrucous carcinoma

Involvement of prostatic urethra
Involvement of prostatic ducts
Noninvasive (flat, sessile), NOS

Localized only

     Muscularis invaded
     Subepithelial connective tissue (lamina propria, submucosa) invaded

     Localized, NOS

Regional by direct extension only

Extension beyond the prostatic capsule

Extension to:
    Bladder neck
    Corpus cavernosum
    Corpus spongiosum
    Periurethral muscle (sphincter)
    Prostate
    Vagina, anterior or NOS

Sphincter muscle; periurethral muscle specified as sphincter

Stated as T3

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
